result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark E Larson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's office on $30.00 per month payment plan as set forth.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Absolute Sobriety.

Must be in compliance with Treatment Court. 
All DJOC conditions are conditions of Probation.
$290.60 fine/cost to Clerk of Court's Office on a $30.00 per month payment plan beginning on 9/1/16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.

timeConds.notes: Banked jail for use of agent if necessary.

supervisions.notes: - $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

- $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

- Subject to Good Time & Work Release.
- Sentence credit of 275 days = TIME SERVED.
Concurrent with: Any other time currently serving

- Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.  
- May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
- If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
- May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
- Eligible for Substance Abuse and Challenge Incarceration Programs.
